definition: to blossom/see 著花|着花[zhao2 hua1]
to blossom/to come to flower/to be in bloom
aspect particle indicating action in progress
to make known/to show/to prove/to write/book/outstanding
to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

sentences.english: So it is what that drives you to move forward and to pursue the unlimited wealth with unremitting efforts?
sentences.chinese: 是什麼促使您執著向前，去爭得明擺著花不完的財富？

sentences.english: By plucking her petals you do not gather the beauty of the flower。
sentences.chinese: 採擷花瓣得不著花的美麗。

definition: delicate hands/woman's tender and soft hands
lit. the red apricot tree leans over the garden wall (idiom)/fig. a wife having an illicit lover
to touch up (a piece of writing)/to add details (to a painting)
to have one's eyes on (a goal)/having sth in mind/to concentrate
variant of 臘梅|腊梅[la4 mei2]
in large numbers/in force/lit. clouds bubbling up
